channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024110450
item.description:
Report E-2024110450

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-26T12:24:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WYOMING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Young's Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted various cardboard packages inside the trailer and estimated that one (1) quart of material was released due inadequate preparation for transit. Young's Environmental personnel placed the impacted cardboard, shrink-wrap, absorbent pads and PPE into one (1) one 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged plastic jug was placed into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110464
item.description:
Report E-2024110464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: SOUTHFIELD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A spill occurred when a Veolia employee was moving drums for transportation at a customer's site. While using the customer's drum cart, the employee noticed that the cart's feet were not fully positioned beneath the drum being moved. Recognizing the potential hazard, the employee halted the operation and attempted to properly secure the drum onto the cart. Unfortunately, during this adjustment, the cart suddenly slipped away from the drum, causing it to fall. The drum's impact with the metal feet of the cart resulted in a puncture near its top section. Reacting swiftly, the employee rotated the drum to minimize further liquid leakage. To contain the situation, the damaged drum was promptly overpacked on the customer's premises. Following this precautionary measure, the drum was successfully shipped without any additional complications.

item.title: Report E-2024110335
item.description:
Report E-2024110335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) pounds of Devere Security Floor Treatment released from one (1) 55-gallon fiber drum. Personnel advised the release impacted the concrete at dock floor. Dayton Freight stated they cleaned up the release with oil dri absorbent. Personnel confirmed they completed cleanup and generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste. Dayton Freight explained that the impacted drum was repaired and will continue shipping to the receiver. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
